Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk 389-ds-base
exit 0

exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk 389-ds-base-libs
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: 389-ds-base bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The 389-ds-base packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.3.4.0, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1201892) Bug fixes: When multi-master replication was configured, this redundant error message was recorded in the log: NSMMReplicationPlugin - write_changelog_and_ruv: failed to update RUV for unknown The message is no longer displayed. (BZ#1096409) When the subtree level was deeper than one, Directory Server sometimes did not select the closest above password policy for the target user entry. The bug has been fixed along with the nested Class of Service (CoS). (BZ#1180331) A helper function to check whether the cache size is valid was resetting the entry and Distinguished Name (DN) cache size to very small values. Now, the helper function provides only the validity check and no longer resets the cache size. (BZ#1226510) The "No original_tombstone for changenumber" error message was logged unnecessarily when no original_tombstone value was defined. The message is now logged only when necessary. (BZ#1235847) After the cleanAllRUV task finished, the change log still contained entries from the cleaned rid. Now, cleanAllRUV cleans the change log completely as expected. (BZ#1240845) The verify-db.pl utility ignored the "-a" option, which specifies the path to the database directory, and instead used the path defined in the Directory Server configuration. The utility now respects "-a" as expected. (BZ#1240876) When AD users had multiple spaces inside the value of the RDN attribute, synchronizing the entry to the Directory Server failed. Now, the WinSync plug-in works as expected. (BZ#1242683) A bug in WinSync account synchronization has been fixed. The ntuserlastlogon attribute is updated on the Directory Server side based upon the lastLogonTimestampand attribute in Active Directory. (BZ#1245235) This update adds scoping to the retrocl plug-in and moves the existing memberOf scoping outside the memberOf global lock. The memberOf and retrocl plug-ins no longer enter a deadlock state when updating multiple back ends at the same time. (BZ#1245519) Complex filters in a search request did not work as expected. Now, the filter optimization no longer mistakenly ignores certain complex subfilters. (BZ#1258996) When multiple replica update vector (RUV) updates were skipped in fractional replication, RUV was not updated at the end of the session, and the next session restarted evaluating the same skipped updates. This update prevents the unnecessary replays. (BZ#1259949) Enhancements: Verifying whether the timestamp of a log is within the start and end times of an event has been improved. The logconv.pl log analysis utility has been improved so that the log report is no longer empty when an event time range does not match the timestamp. (BZ#1160243) To improve replication throughput, the nsDS5ReplicaWaitForAsyncResults attribute has been added to the nsDS5ReplicationAgreement class. The attribute defines how long a supplier waits for the response from a consumer. Its value is specified in milliseconds; the default is 1 second. (BZ#1171358) Added the memberOfSkipNested attribute, which accepts the "on" or "off" values, to improve delete performance when no nested groups are present. When set to "on", nested group lookups are not performed during a group delete operation. (BZ#1174457) A new Nunc Stans event framework to handle multiple simultaneous connections has been added as Technology Preview. The framework allows supporting several thousand active connections with no performance degradation. It is disabled by default. (BZ#1206301) Users of 389-ds-base are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. After installing this update, the 389 server service will be restarted automatically. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
